elements.name: Support of Feature Plus Scenario Outline

        simple feature description

    Scenario Outline: simple scenario
        simple scenario description

    Examples: simple examples
    | status |
    | pass   |
    | fail   |

steps.name: I run feature suite with formatter "cucumber"
the rendered json will be as follows:

doc_string.value:
[
    {
      "uri": "features/simple.feature",
      "id": "simple-feature",
      "keyword": "Feature",
      "name": "simple feature",
      "description": "        simple feature description",
      "line": 1,
      "elements": [
        {
          "id": "simple-feature;simple-scenario;simple-examples;2",
          "keyword": "Scenario Outline",
          "name": "simple scenario",
          "description": "        simple scenario description",
          "line": 9,
          "type": "scenario"
        },
        {
          "id": "simple-feature;simple-scenario;simple-examples;3",
          "keyword": "Scenario Outline",
          "name": "simple scenario",
          "description": "        simple scenario description",
          "line": 10,
          "type": "scenario"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]

elements.name: Support of Undefined, Pending and Skipped status

doc_string.value:
Feature: simple feature
  simple feature description

  Scenario: simple scenario
  simple scenario description

    Given passing step
    And pending step
    And undefined
    And passing step

steps.name: I run feature suite with formatter "pretty"
the rendered output will be as follows:

doc_string.value:
Feature: simple feature
    simple feature description

    Scenario: simple scenario # features/simple.feature:4
      Given passing step      # suite_context.go:0 -> github.com/cucumber/godog.SuiteContext.func2
      And pending step        # suite_context.go:0 -> github.com/cucumber/godog.SuiteContext.func1
        TODO: write pending definition
      And undefined
      And passing step        # suite_context.go:0 -> github.com/cucumber/godog.SuiteContext.func2

  1 scenarios (1 pending, 1 undefined)
  4 steps (1 passed, 1 pending, 1 undefined, 1 skipped)
  0s

  You can implement step definitions for undefined steps with these snippets:

  func undefined() error {
    return godog.ErrPending
  }

  func FeatureContext(s *godog.Suite) {
    s.Step(`^undefined$`, undefined)
  }

      | features/load.feature:3 | 0   |

  Background:
    Given I'm listening to suite events

    Given a feature path "<path>"
    When I run feature suite

      | BeforeScenario | <scen> |
      | BeforeStep     | <step> |

    Examples:
      | path                    | scen | step |
      | features/load.feature:6 | 1    | 3    |
      | features/load.feature   | 6    | 19   |

doc_string.value:
Feature: undefined steps

  Scenario: get version number from api
    When I send "GET" request to "/version" with:
      | col1 | val1 |
      | col2 | val2 |
    Then the response code should be 200 and header "X-Powered-By" should be "godog"

steps.name: the undefined step snippets should be:

name: tag filters
description:
In order to test application behavior
  As a test suite
  I need to be able to filter features and scenarios by tags

elements.name: should filter outline examples by tags

doc_string.value:
Feature: outline

  Background:
    Given passing step

  Scenario Outline: parse a scenario
    Given a feature path "<path>"
    When I parse features
    Then I should have <num> scenario registered

    Examples:
      | path                    | num |
      | features/load.feature:3 | 0   |

    @used
    Examples:
      | path                    | num |
      | features/load.feature:6 | 1   |

steps.name: I run feature suite with tags "@used"
the following steps should be passed:

doc_string.value:
I parse features
a feature path "features/load.feature:6"
I should have 1 scenario registered

elements.name: should filter scenarios by X tag

steps.name: I run feature suite with tags "@x"
the following steps should be passed:

doc_string.value:
a feature path "one"
a feature path "two"
a feature path "three"

elements.name: should filter scenarios by X tag not having Y

steps.name: I run feature suite with tags "@x && ~@y"
the following steps should be passed:

doc_string.value:
a feature path "one"
a feature path "two"

elements.name: should filter scenarios having Y and Z tags

steps.name: I run feature suite with tags "@y && @z"
the following steps should be passed:
